Hoze Kalderon otišao u penziju, ali ostaje u košarci
Španac dobio poziciju specijalnog asistenta u asocijaciji NBA košarkaša

04 Nov 2019

Duga i uspešna košarkaška karijera Hozea Kalderona je zvanično okončana. Španski igrač objavio je da se povlači iz košarke, pošto je u međuvremenu prihvatio posao u asocijaciji košarkaša NBA lige. Kako navode američki mediji, biće specijalni asistent izvršnom direktoru, Majklu Robertsu.
Španac, koji je nedavno napunio 38 godina tako je stavio tačku na veoma uspešnu dvadesetogodišnju karijeru koju je započeo davne 1998. godine. U NBA ligu se „preselio“ 2005. godine, a sveukupno je upisao 935 nastupa, uključujući i 40 u plej-ofu.
Nakon što je tri godine proveo u Tau Keramici između 2002. i 2005. godine, Kalderon je prešao u Toronto Raptorse gde je proveo čitavih osam leta, da bi nakon toga imao kratke izlete u Detroit Pistonsima, Dalas Maveriksima, Njujork Niksima, Los Anđeles Lejkersima, Atlanta Hoksima i Klivlend Kavalirsima.
Za sve vreme provedeno u najjačoj košarkaškoj ligi na svetu, Kalderon je u proseku dolazio do 8,9 poena po utakmici uz 5,8 asistencija i 2,4 uhvaćene lopte. Zanimljivo je da je imao veoma visoke procente šuta, pošto je sveukupno mogao da se pohvali sa preciznošću od 47,2%. Sa linije za slobodna bacanja gotovo da nije ni promašivao - imao je neverovatnih 92,9%.
Pored toga što je blistao u NBA ligi, Kalderon je istovremeno imao velikog uspeha i na reprezentativnom polju. U juniorskoj konkurenciji osvojio je brojne medalje, da bi nakon toga u seniorskoj došao do tri odličja na Olimpijskim igrama, jednog zlata na Svetskom prvenstvu, kao i četiri medalje na Evrobasketu (uključujući i jedno zlato). Poslednji put je obukao dres Furije sada već davne 2016. godine.
Kako je i bilo nagovešteno u poslednji nekoliko meseci, španski košarkaš nije uspeo da dođe do novog ugovora, ali je izrazio jaku želju da ostane u SAD-u zbog dece.

Jose Calderon retired but remains in basketball
The Spaniard received a special assistant position in the NBA Basketball Association

04 Nov 2019

Jose Calderon's long and successful basketball career is officially over. The Spanish player has announced that he is retiring from basketball, as he has accepted a job at the NBA League Basketball Association in the meantime. According to the US media, he will be special assistant to the CEO, Michael Roberts.
The Spaniard, who recently turned 38, has put an end to a very successful 20-year career that he started back in 1998. He moved to the NBA in 2005 and made 935 appearances, including 40 in the playoffs.
After spending three years at Tau Ceramics between 2002 and 2005, Calderon moved to the Toronto Raptors where he spent the entire eight summers, after which he made short trips to the Detroit Pistons, Dallas Mavericks, New York Knicks, Los Angeles Lakers. , Atlanta Hawks and Cleveland Cavaliers.
In all his time in the strongest basketball league in the world, Calderon averaged 8.9 points per game with 5.8 assists and 2.4 catches. Interestingly, he had very high shot percentages, as he was able to boast an overall accuracy of 47.2%. He almost missed from the free throw line - a whopping 92.9%.
In addition to glittering in the NBA, Calderon has also had great success on the national team. He won numerous medals in the junior competition, after which he won three medals in the senior Olympics, one gold in the World Cup, as well as four medals in the Eurobasket (including one gold). He last wore a Fury jersey now back in 2016.
As has been hinted at in recent months, the Spanish basketball player has not been able to come up with a new contract, but has expressed a strong desire to remain in the US because of the children.
